question_text: What distinguishes a signal converter from a passive adapter?
answer_options: Converters are used only for USB, not video
Adapters can convert between digital and analog signals
Signal converters actively translate between signal types, while passive adapters rely on signal compatibility
correct_answer: Signal converters actively translate between signal types, while passive adapters rely on signal compatibility
explanation: Signal converters handle protocol translation (e.g., DisplayPort to HDMI), while passive adapters only reroute pins when formats are already compatible.
